masterball.name: Master Ball
masterball.desc: The best Poké Ball with the ultimate level of performance. With it, you will catch any wild Pokémon without fail.

ultraball.name: Ultra Ball
ultraball.desc: An ultra-high-performance Poké Ball that provides a higher success rate for catching Pokémon than a Great Ball. (2x Catch Rate)

greatball.name: Great Ball
greatball.desc: A good, high-performance Poké Ball that provides a higher Pokémon catch rate than a standard Poké Ball. (1.5x Catch Rate)

pokeball.name: Poké Ball
pokeball.desc: A device for catching wild Pokémon. It’s thrown like a ball at a Pokémon, comfortably encapsulating its target. (1x Catch Rate)

safariball.name: Safari Ball
safariball.desc: A special Poké Ball that is used only in the Great Marsh. It is recognizable by the camouflage pattern decorating it. (1.5x Catch Rate)

netball.name: Net Ball
netball.desc: A somewhat different Poké Ball that is more effective when attempting to catch Water- or Bug-type Pokémon. (3.5x Catch Rate if Water or Bug)

diveball.name: Dive Ball
diveball.desc: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well when catching Pokémon that live underwater. (3.5x Catch Rate if Surf/Fishing)

nestball.name: Nest Ball
nestball.desc: A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes more effective the lower the level of the wild Pokémon. (4x-1x Catch Rate on Pokémon lvl 1-29)

repeatball.name: Repeat Ball
repeatball.desc: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on a Pokémon species that has been caught before. (3.5x Catch Rate if owned in Pokédex)

timerball.name: Timer Ball
timerball.desc: A somewhat different Poké Ball that becomes progressively more effective the more turns that are taken in battle. (1x-4x Catch Rate 1-10 turns passed.)

luxuryball.name: Luxury Ball
luxuryball.desc: A comfy Poké Ball that makes a Pokémon quickly grow friendlier. (1x Catch Rate) Friendship bonuses are increased by +1.

premierball.name: Premier Ball
premierball.desc: A somewhat rare Poké Ball that was made as a commemorative item used to celebrate an event of some sort. (1x Catch Rate)

duskball.name: Dusk Ball
duskball.desc: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon at night or in dark places like caves. (3.5x Catch Rate in dark places)

healball.name: Heal Ball
healball.desc: A remedial Poké Ball that restores the HP of a Pokémon caught with it and eliminates any status conditions. (1x Catch Rate)

quickball.name: Quick Ball
quickball.desc: A somewhat different Poké Ball that has a more successful catch rate if used at the start of a wild encounter. (5x Catch Rate if used on first turn.)

cherishball.name: Cherish Ball
cherishball.desc: A quite rare Poké Ball that has been crafted in order to commemorate a special occasion of some sort. (1x Catch Rate)

potion.name: Potion
potion.desc: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 20 HP to an injured Pokémon.

antidote.name: Antidote
antidote.desc: A spray-type medicine for poisoning. It can be used once to lift the effects of being poisoned from a Pokémon.

burnheal.name: Burn Heal
burnheal.desc: A spray-type medicine for treating burns. It can be used once to heal a Pokémon suffering from a burn.

iceheal.name: Ice Heal
iceheal.desc: A spray-type medicine for freezing. It can be used once to defrost a Pokémon that has been frozen solid.

awakening.name: Awakening
awakening.desc: A spray-type medicine used against sleep. It can be used once to rouse a Pokémon from the clutches of sleep.

paralyzeheal.name: Paralyze Heal
paralyzeheal.desc: A spray-type medicine for paralysis. It can be used once to free a Pokémon that has been paralyzed.

fullrestore.name: Full Restore
fullrestore.desc: A medicine that can be used to fully restore the HP of a single Pokémon and heal any status conditions it has.

maxpotion.name: Max Potion
maxpotion.desc: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It will completely restore the max HP of a single Pokémon.

hyperpotion.name: Hyper Potion
hyperpotion.desc: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 120 HP to an injured Pokémon.

superpotion.name: Super Potion
superpotion.desc: A spray-type medicine for treating wounds. It can be used to restore 60 HP to an injured Pokémon.

fullheal.name: Full Heal
fullheal.desc: A spray-type medicine that is broadly effective. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

revive.name: Revive
revive.desc: A medicine that can revive fainted Pokémon. It also restores 25% of a fainted Pokémon’s maximum HP.

maxrevive.name: Max Revive
maxrevive.desc: A medicine that can revive fainted Pokémon. It also restores half of a fainted Pokémon’s maximum HP.

freshwater.name: Fresh Water
freshwater.desc: Water with a high mineral content. When consumed, it restores up to 30 HP to an injured Pokémon.

sodapop.name: Soda Pop
sodapop.desc: A highly carbonated soda drink. When consumed, it restores up to 50 HP to an injured Pokémon.

lemonade.name: Lemonade
lemonade.desc: A very sweet and refreshing drink. When consumed, it restores up to 70 HP to an injured Pokémon.

moomoomilk.name: Moomoo Milk
moomoomilk.desc: A bottle of highly nutritious milk. When consumed, it restores up to 100 HP to an injured Pokémon.

energypowder.name: Energy Powder
energypowder.desc: A very bitter medicinal powder. When consumed, it restores up to 60 HP to an injured Pokémon. Lower's your Pokémon's friendship when used...

energyroot.name: Energy Root
energyroot.desc: An extremely bitter medicinal root. When consumed, it restores up to 120 HP to an injured Pokémon. Lower's your Pokémon's friendship when used...

healpowder.name: Heal Powder
healpowder.desc: A very bitter medicinal powder. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon. Lower's your Pokémon's friendship when used...

revivalherb.name: Revival Herb
revivalherb.desc: A terribly bitter medicinal herb. It revives a fainted Pokémon and fully restores its maximum HP. Lower's your Pokémon's friendship when used...

ether.name: Ether
ether.desc: This medicine can restore 10 PP to a single selected move that has been learned by a Pokémon.

maxether.name: Max Ether
maxether.desc: This medicine can fully restore the PP of a single selected move that has been learned by a Pokémon.

elixir.name: Elixir
elixir.desc: This medicine can restore 10 PP to each of the moves that have been learned by a Pokémon.

maxelixir.name: Max Elixir
maxelixir.desc: This medicine can fully restore the PP of all of the moves that have been learned by a Pokémon.

moldycookie.name: Moldy Cookie
moldycookie.desc: An offensive smelling cookie you wouldn't dare put into your mouth. Forcing your Pokémon to eat a few of these will lower their Friendship fast.

berryjuice.name: Berry Juice
berryjuice.desc: A 100 percent pure juice made of Berries. When consumed, it restores 40 HP to an injured Pokémon. (Eaten at 50% HP)

sacredash.name: Sacred Ash
sacredash.desc: This rare ash can revive all fainted Pokémon in a party. In doing so, it also fully restores their maximum HP.

hpup.name: HP Up
hpup.desc: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. Does nothing. Strange. Might as well sell this then!

protein.name: Protein
protein.desc: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. Does nothing. Strange. Might as well sell this then!

iron.name: Iron
iron.desc: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. Does nothing. Strange. Might as well sell this then!

carbos.name: Carbos
carbos.desc: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. Does nothing. Strange. Might as well sell this then!

calcium.name: Calcium
calcium.desc: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. Does nothing. Strange. Might as well sell this then!

rarecandy.name: Rare Candy
rarecandy.desc: A candy that is packed with energy. When consumed, it will instantly raise the level of a single Pokémon by one.

ppup.name: PP Up
ppup.desc: A medicine that can slightly raise the maximum PP of a single move that has been learned by the target Pokémon. Max 3 uses per move.

zinc.name: Zinc
zinc.desc: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. Does nothing. Strange. Might as well sell this then!

ppmax.name: PP Max
ppmax.desc: A medicine that can optimally raise the maximum PP of a single move that has been learned by the target Pokémon.

oldgateau.name: Old Gateau
oldgateau.desc: The Old Chateau’s hidden specialty. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

guardspec.name: Guard Spec.
guardspec.desc: An item that prevents stat reduction among the Trainer’s party Pokémon for five turns after it is used in battle.

direhit.name: Dire Hit
direhit.desc: An item that raises the critical-hit ratio greatly. It can be used only once and wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

xattack.name: X Attack
xattack.desc: An item that sharply boosts the Attack stat of a Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the Pokémon is withdrawn.

xdefense.name: X Defense
xdefense.desc: An item that sharply boosts the Defense stat of a Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the Pokémon is withdrawn.

xspeed.name: X Speed
xspeed.desc: An item that sharply boosts the Speed stat of a Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the Pokémon is withdrawn.

xaccuracy.name: X Accuracy
xaccuracy.desc: An item that sharply boosts the Accuracy of a Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the Pokémon is withdrawn.

xspatk.name: X Sp. Atk
xspatk.desc: An item that sharply boosts the Sp. Atk stat of a Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the Pokémon is withdrawn.

xspdef.name: X Sp. Def
xspdef.desc: An item that sharply boosts the Sp. Def stat of a Pokémon during a battle. It wears off once the Pokémon is withdrawn.

pokdoll.name: Poké Doll
pokdoll.desc: A doll that attracts the attention of a Pokémon. It guarantees escape from any battle with wild Pokémon.

fluffytail.name: Fluffy Tail
fluffytail.desc: A toy that attracts the attention of a Pokémon. It guarantees escape from any battle with wild Pokémon.

blueflute.name: Blue Flute
blueflute.desc: A flute made from blue glass that awakens sleeping Pokémon.

yellowflute.name: Yellow Flute
yellowflute.desc: A flute made from yellow glass that snaps Pokémon out of confusion.

redflute.name: Red Flute
redflute.desc: A flute made from red glass that snaps Pokémon out of infatuation.

blackflute.name: Black Flute
blackflute.desc: A flute made from black glass. It makes it easier to encounter strong Pokémon in the place you use it.

whiteflute.name: White Flute
whiteflute.desc: A flute made from white glass. It makes it easier to encounter weak Pokémon in the place you use it.

shoalsalt.name: Shoal Salt
shoalsalt.desc: Salt that you found inside Shoal Cave.

shoalshell.name: Shoal Shell
shoalshell.desc: A seashell that you found inside Shoal Cave.

redshard.name: Red Shard
redshard.desc: A small red shard. It appears to be a fragment of some sort of implement made long ago.

blueshard.name: Blue Shard
blueshard.desc: A small blue shard. It appears to be a fragment of some sort of implement made long ago.

yellowshard.name: Yellow Shard
yellowshard.desc: A small yellow shard. It appears to be a fragment of some sort of implement made long ago.

greenshard.name: Green Shard
greenshard.desc: A small green shard. It appears to be a fragment of some sort of implement made long ago.

superrepel.name: Super Repel
superrepel.desc: An item that prevents any low-level wild Pokémon from jumping out at you for a while. It lasts longer than Repel.

maxrepel.name: Max Repel
maxrepel.desc: An item that prevents any low-level wild Pokémon from jumping out at you for a while. It lasts longer than Super Repel.

escaperope.name: Escape Rope
escaperope.desc: A long and durable rope. Use it to escape instantly from a cave or a dungeon.

repel.name: Repel
repel.desc: An item that prevents any low-level wild Pokémon from jumping out at you for a while.

sunstone.name: Sun Stone
sunstone.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It burns as red as the evening sun. Evolves: Eevee, Rockruff, Cosmoem.

moonstone.name: Moon Stone
moonstone.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is as black as the night sky. Evolves: Eevee, Rockruff, Cosmoem.

firestone.name: Fire Stone
firestone.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. The stone has a fiery orange heart. Evolves: Eevee.

thunderstone.name: Thunder Stone
thunderstone.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It has a distinct thunderbolt pattern. Evolves: Eevee.

waterstone.name: Water Stone
waterstone.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is the blue of a pool of clear water. Evolves: Eevee.

leafstone.name: Leaf Stone
leafstone.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It has an unmistakable leaf pattern. Evolves: Eevee.

tinymushroom.name: Tiny Mushroom
tinymushroom.desc: A very small and rare mushroom. It’s popular with a certain class of collectors and sought out by them.

bigmushroom.name: Big Mushroom
bigmushroom.desc: A very large and rare mushroom. It’s popular with a certain class of collectors and sought out by them.

pearl.name: Pearl
pearl.desc: A rather small pearl that has a very nice silvery sheen to it. It can be sold cheaply to shops.

bigpearl.name: Big Pearl
bigpearl.desc: A rather large pearl that has a very nice silvery sheen. It can be sold to shops for a high price.

stardust.name: Stardust
stardust.desc: Lovely red sand that flows between the fingers with a loose, silky feel. It can be sold at a low price to shops.

starpiece.name: Star Piece
starpiece.desc: A small shard of a beautiful gem that demonstrates a distinctly red sparkle. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

nugget.name: Nugget
nugget.desc: A nugget of the purest gold that gives off a lustrous gleam in direct light. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

heartscale.name: Heart Scale
heartscale.desc: A pretty, heart-shaped scale. Take these to the move relearner on the left side of any Pokémon Center to use their services!

honey.name: Honey
honey.desc: A sweet honey with a lush aroma that attracts wild Pokémon when it is used in tall grass, in caves, or on special trees.

growthmulch.name: Growth Mulch
growthmulch.desc: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

dampmulch.name: Damp Mulch
dampmulch.desc: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

stablemulch.name: Stable Mulch
stablemulch.desc: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

gooeymulch.name: Gooey Mulch
gooeymulch.desc: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

rootfossil.name: Root Fossil
rootfossil.desc: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It looks as if it could be part of a plant’s root.

clawfossil.name: Claw Fossil
clawfossil.desc: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It appears to be a fragment of a claw.

helixfossil.name: Helix Fossil
helixfossil.desc: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It might be a piece of a seashell.

domefossil.name: Dome Fossil
domefossil.desc: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It could be a shell or carapace.

oldamber.name: Old Amber
oldamber.desc: A piece of amber that still contains the genetic material of an ancient Pokémon. It’s clear with a tawny, reddish tint.

armorfossil.name: Armor Fossil
armorfossil.desc: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It looks to be from some kind of protective collar.

skullfossil.name: Skull Fossil
skullfossil.desc: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It appears as though it’s part of a head.

rarebone.name: Rare Bone
rarebone.desc: A rare bone that is extremely valuable for the study of Pokémon archeology. It can be sold for a high price to shops.

shinystone.name: Shiny Stone
shinystone.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It shines with a dazzling light. Evolves: Eevee>Sylveon, Tyrogue>Hitmontop.

duskstone.name: Dusk Stone
duskstone.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It holds shadows as dark as can be. Evolves: Tyrogue>Hitmonlee, Rockruff, Cosmoem.

dawnstone.name: Dawn Stone
dawnstone.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It sparkles like a glittering eye. Evolves: Tyrogue>Hitmonchan, Cosmoem.

ovalstone.name: Oval Stone
ovalstone.desc: A peculiar stone that can make no species of Pokémon evolve, because it’s just a rock. It’s as round as a Pokémon Egg.

oddkeystone.name: Odd Keystone
oddkeystone.desc: A vital item that is needed to keep a stone tower from collapsing. Voices can be heard from it occasionally.

griseousorb.name: Griseous Orb
griseousorb.desc: A glowing orb to be held by Giratina. It boosts the power of Dragon- and Ghost-type moves by 20% when it is held. Transforms Giratina into its Origin form.

dousedrive.name: Douse Drive
dousedrive.desc: A cassette to be held. It changes the move Techno Blast so it becomes Water type. Cannot be taken or removed in battle.

shockdrive.name: Shock Drive
shockdrive.desc: A cassette to be held. It changes the move Techno Blast so it becomes Electric type. Cannot be taken or removed in battle.

burndrive.name: Burn Drive
burndrive.desc: A cassette to be held. It changes the move Techno Blast so it becomes Fire type. Cannot be taken or removed in battle.

chilldrive.name: Chill Drive
chilldrive.desc: A cassette to be held. It changes the move Techno Blast so it becomes Ice type. Cannot be taken or removed in battle.

bffheart.name: B.F.F Heart
bffheart.desc: Otherworldly chocolate infused with a secret ingredient that makes a Pokémon love you! A few of these will max out Friendship.

adamantorb.name: Adamant Orb
adamantorb.desc: A brightly gleaming orb to be held by Dialga. It boosts the power of Dragon- and Steel-type moves by 20% when it is held.

lustrousorb.name: Lustrous Orb
lustrousorb.desc: A beautifully glowing orb to be held by Palkia. It boosts the power of Dragon- and Water-type moves by 20% when it is held.

greetmail.name: Greet Mail
greetmail.desc: Stationery designed to be easy to use when writing someone for the first time. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

favoredmail.name: Favored Mail
favoredmail.desc: Stationery designed to make it easier to write about your favorite things. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

rsvpmail.name: RSVP Mail
rsvpmail.desc: Stationery designed to allow you to extend an invitation to the recipient. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

thanksmail.name: Thanks Mail
thanksmail.desc: Stationery designed to make it easy for you to express thanks. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

inquirymail.name: Inquiry Mail
inquirymail.desc: Stationery designed to make it easier to pose a question about something. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

likemail.name: Like Mail
likemail.desc: Stationery designed to allow you to recommend something to the reader. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

replymail.name: Reply Mail
replymail.desc: Stationery designed to make it easy to respond to a letter you received. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

bridgemails.name: Bridge Mail S
bridgemails.desc: Stationery featuring an illustration of a bridge that seems to pierce the sky. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

bridgemaild.name: Bridge Mail D
bridgemaild.desc: Stationery featuring an illustration of a bright-red drawbridge. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

bridgemailt.name: Bridge Mail T
bridgemailt.desc: Stationery featuring an illustration of a high-tension steel suspension bridge. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

bridgemailv.name: Bridge Mail V
bridgemailv.desc: Stationery featuring an illustration of a vintage-looking brick bridge. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

bridgemailm.name: Bridge Mail M
bridgemailm.desc: Stationery featuring an illustration of a majestically arched bridge. Have a Pokémon hold it for delivery.

cheriberry.name: Cheri Berry
cheriberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from paralysis on its own in battle.

chestoberry.name: Chesto Berry
chestoberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from sleep on its own in battle.

pechaberry.name: Pecha Berry
pechaberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from poisoning on its own in battle.

rawstberry.name: Rawst Berry
rawstberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from a burn on its own in battle.

aspearberry.name: Aspear Berry
aspearberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from being frostbitten on its own in battle.

leppaberry.name: Leppa Berry
leppaberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can restore 10 PP to a depleted move during battle.

oranberry.name: Oran Berry
oranberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can restore its own HP by 20 points during battle when it falls below 50% HP.

persimberry.name: Persim Berry
persimberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from confusion on its own in battle.

lumberry.name: Lum Berry
lumberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can recover from any status condition during battle.

sitrusberry.name: Sitrus Berry
sitrusberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it can restore its own HP by a 25% during battle when it falls below 50% HP.

figyberry.name: Figy Berry
figyberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the user’s HP by 50% after falling below 25% HP, but it will cause confusion if the user has a -Attack Nature.

wikiberry.name: Wiki Berry
wikiberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the user’s HP by 50% after falling below 25% HP, but it will cause confusion if the user has a -Sp.Atk Nature.

magoberry.name: Mago Berry
magoberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the user’s HP by 50% after falling below 25% HP, but it will cause confusion if the user has a -Speed Nature.

aguavberry.name: Aguav Berry
aguavberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the user’s HP by 50% after falling below 25% HP, but it will cause confusion if the user has a -Sp. Def Nature.

iapapaberry.name: Iapapa Berry
iapapaberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, it restores the user’s HP by 50% after falling below 25% HP, but it will cause confusion if the user has a -Def Nature.

razzberry.name: Razz Berry
razzberry.desc: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Coolness. Its red flesh is spicy when eaten.

blukberry.name: Bluk Berry
blukberry.desc: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Beauty. Its blue flesh is sour when eaten.

nanabberry.name: Nanab Berry
nanabberry.desc: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Cuteness. Its pink flesh is sweet when eaten.

wepearberry.name: Wepear Berry
wepearberry.desc: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Cleverness. Its green flesh is bitter when eaten.

pinapberry.name: Pinap Berry
pinapberry.desc: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Toughness. Its yellow flesh is sour when eaten.

pomegberry.name: Pomeg Berry
pomegberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. Using it on a Pokémon makes it more friendly but lowers its base HP by 10 EVs

kelpsyberry.name: Kelpsy Berry
kelpsyberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. Using it on a Pokémon makes it more friendly but lowers its base Attack by 10 EVs

qualotberry.name: Qualot Berry
qualotberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. Using it on a Pokémon makes it more friendly but lowers its base Defense by 10 EVs

hondewberry.name: Hondew Berry
hondewberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. Using it on a Pokémon makes it more friendly but lowers its base Sp. Atk by 10 EVs

grepaberry.name: Grepa Berry
grepaberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. Using it on a Pokémon makes it more friendly but lowers its base Sp. Def by 10 EVs

tamatoberry.name: Tamato Berry
tamatoberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. Using it on a Pokémon makes it more friendly but lowers its base Speed by 10 EVs

cornnberry.name: Cornn Berry
cornnberry.desc: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Beauty, this Berry is rare in other regions.

magostberry.name: Magost Berry
magostberry.desc: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Cuteness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

rabutaberry.name: Rabuta Berry
rabutaberry.desc: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Cleverness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

durinberry.name: Durin Berry
durinberry.desc: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Cleverness, this Berry is rare in other regions.

belueberry.name: Belue Berry
belueberry.desc: Used to make Pokéblocks that will enhance your Beauty, this Berry is rare in other regions.

occaberry.name: Occa Berry
occaberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Fire-type attack.

passhoberry.name: Passho Berry
passhoberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Water-type attack.

wacanberry.name: Wacan Berry
wacanberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Electric-type attack.

rindoberry.name: Rindo Berry
rindoberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Grass-type attack.

yacheberry.name: Yache Berry
yacheberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Ice-type attack.

chopleberry.name: Chople Berry
chopleberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Fighting-type attack.

kebiaberry.name: Kebia Berry
kebiaberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Poison-type attack.

shucaberry.name: Shuca Berry
shucaberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Ground-type attack.

cobaberry.name: Coba Berry
