payapaberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Psychic-type attack.

tangaberry.name: Tanga Berry
tangaberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Bug-type attack.

chartiberry.name: Charti Berry
chartiberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Rock-type attack.

kasibberry.name: Kasib Berry
kasibberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Ghost-type attack.

habanberry.name: Haban Berry
habanberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Dragon-type attack.

colburberry.name: Colbur Berry
colburberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Dark-type attack.

babiriberry.name: Babiri Berry
babiriberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Steel-type attack.

chilanberry.name: Chilan Berry
chilanberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one Normal-type attack.

liechiberry.name: Liechi Berry
liechiberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its Attack stat will increase when it’s in a pinch. (Less than 33% HP)

ganlonberry.name: Ganlon Berry
ganlonberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its Defense stat will increase when it’s in a pinch. (Less than 50% HP)

salacberry.name: Salac Berry
salacberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its Speed stat will increase when it’s in a pinch. (Less than 33% HP)

petayaberry.name: Petaya Berry
petayaberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its Sp. Atk stat will increase when it’s in a pinch. (Less than 33% HP)

apicotberry.name: Apicot Berry
apicotberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its Sp. Def stat will increase when it’s in a pinch. (Less than 50% HP)

lansatberry.name: Lansat Berry
lansatberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its critical-hit ratio will increase when it’s in a pinch. (Less than 33% HP)

starfberry.name: Starf Berry
starfberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, one of its stats will sharply increase when it’s in a pinch. (Less than 33% HP)

enigmaberry.name: Enigma Berry
enigmaberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, being hit by a supereffective attack will restore its HP by 50%.

micleberry.name: Micle Berry
micleberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, its Accuracy will increase just once when it’s in a pinch. (Less than 50% HP)

custapberry.name: Custap Berry
custapberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a Pokémon holds one, it will be able to move first just once when it’s in a pinch. (Less than 33% HP)

jabocaberry.name: Jaboca Berry
jabocaberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a physical attack hits the Pokémon holding it, the attacker will also be hurt by 1/6 of their HP.

rowapberry.name: Rowap Berry
rowapberry.desc: A Berry to be consumed by Pokémon. If a special attack hits the Pokémon holding it, the attacker will also be hurt by 1/6 of their HP.

brightpowder.name: Bright Powder
brightpowder.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It casts a tricky glare that lowers the opposing Pokémon’s Accuracy by 10% when targetting the holder.

whiteherb.name: White Herb
whiteherb.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It will restore any lowered stat in battle. It can be used only once.

machobrace.name: Macho Brace
machobrace.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This stiff, heavy brace helps Pokémon grow strong but halves Speed in battle.

expshare.name: Exp. Share
expshare.desc: Turning this on allows all party Pokémon to gain EXP. Recommended to keep this on. Check your Trainer Passport to see the Boss level caps.

quickclaw.name: Quick Claw
quickclaw.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This light, sharp claw gives the user a 20% chance each turn to move first in its priority bracket.

soothebell.name: Soothe Bell
soothebell.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The comforting chime of this bell calms the holder, making it friendly faster. 50% bonus friendship gains.

mentalherb.name: Mental Herb
mentalherb.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder shakes off move-binding effects. Applies to Taunt, Encore, Torment, Heal Block, Infatuation, and Disable.

choiceband.name: Choice Band
choiceband.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This curious headband boosts Attack by 50% but only allows the use of one move until swapped out.

kingsrock.name: King’s Rock
kingsrock.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder successfully inflicts damage, the target has a 10% chance to flinch if the move doesn’t already flinch.

silverpowder.name: Silver Powder
silverpowder.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a shiny silver powder that will boost the power of Bug-type moves by 20%.

amuletcoin.name: Amulet Coin
amuletcoin.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It doubles any prize money received if the holding Pokémon joins a battle.

cleansetag.name: Cleanse Tag
cleansetag.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It helps keep wild Pokémon away if the holder is the head of the party.

souldew.name: Soul Dew
souldew.desc: A wondrous orb to be held by either Latios or Latias. It raises the power of Psychic- and Dragon-type moves by 20%.

deepseatooth.name: Deep Sea Tooth
deepseatooth.desc: An item to be held by Clamperl. This fang gleams a sharp silver and doubles the holder’s Sp. Atk stat!

deepseascale.name: Deep Sea Scale
deepseascale.desc: An item to be held by Clamperl. This scale shines with a faint pink and doubles the holder’s Sp. Def stat!

smokeball.name: Smoke Ball
smokeball.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It enables the holder to flee from any wild Pokémon encounter without fail.

everstone.name: Everstone
everstone.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. A Pokémon holding this peculiar stone is prevented from evolving.

focusband.name: Focus Band
focusband.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder has a 10% chance to endure a potential KO attack, leaving it with just 1 HP.

luckyegg.name: Lucky Egg
luckyegg.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s an egg filled with happiness that earns 50% extra Exp. Points in battle.

scopelens.name: Scope Lens
scopelens.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a lens for scoping out weak points. It boosts the holder’s critical-hit ratio by +1.

metalcoat.name: Metal Coat
metalcoat.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a special metallic film that can boost the power of Steel-type moves by 20%.

leftovers.name: Leftovers
leftovers.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder’s HP is slowly but steadily restored throughout every battle. 1/16 HP recovered per turn.

dragonscale.name: Dragon Scale
dragonscale.desc: A very tough and inflexible scale. Dragon-type Pokémon may be holding this item when caught.

lightball.name: Light Ball
lightball.desc: An item to be held by Pikachu. It’s a puzzling orb that doubles its Attack and Sp. Atk stats!

softsand.name: Soft Sand
softsand.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a loose, silky sand that boosts the power of Ground-type moves by 20%.

hardstone.name: Hard Stone
hardstone.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a durable stone that boosts the power of Rock-type moves by 20%.

miracleseed.name: Miracle Seed
miracleseed.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a seed imbued with life force that boosts the power of Grass-type moves by 20%.

blackglasses.name: Black Glasses
blackglasses.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. A pair of shady-looking glasses that boost the power of Dark-type moves by 20%.

blackbelt.name: Black Belt
blackbelt.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This belt helps the wearer to focus and boosts the power of Fighting-type moves by 20%.

magnet.name: Magnet
magnet.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a powerful magnet that boosts the power of Electric-type moves by 20%.

mysticwater.name: Mystic Water
mysticwater.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This teardrop-shaped gem boosts the power of Water-type moves by 20%.

sharpbeak.name: Sharp Beak
sharpbeak.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a long, sharp beak that boosts the power of Flying-type moves by 20%.

poisonbarb.name: Poison Barb
poisonbarb.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This small, poisonous barb boosts the power of Poison-type moves by 20%.

nevermeltice.name: Never-Melt Ice
nevermeltice.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a heat- repelling piece of ice that boosts the power of Ice-type moves by 20%.

spelltag.name: Spell Tag
spelltag.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a sinister, eerie tag that boosts the power of Ghost-type moves by 20%.

twistedspoon.name: Twisted Spoon
twistedspoon.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This spoon is imbued with telekinetic power and boosts Psychic-type moves by 20%.

charcoal.name: Charcoal
charcoal.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a combustible fuel that boosts the power of Fire-type moves by 20%.

dragonfang.name: Dragon Fang
dragonfang.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This hard and sharp fang boosts the power of Dragon-type moves by 20%.

silkscarf.name: Silk Scarf
silkscarf.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a sumptuous scarf that boosts the power of Normal-type moves by 20%.

upgrade.name: Up-Grade
upgrade.desc: A transparent device somehow filled with all sorts of data. It was produced by Silph Co.

shellbell.name: Shell Bell
shellbell.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder regains a little HP every time it inflicts damage on others. 1/5 damage dealt is recovered.

seaincense.name: Sea Incense
seaincense.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This incense has a curious aroma that boosts the power of Water-type moves by 20%.

laxincense.name: Lax Incense
laxincense.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The beguiling aroma of this incense may cause attacks to miss its holder. Lowers Accuracy of moves by 10%.

luckypunch.name: Lucky Punch
luckypunch.desc: An item to be held by Chansey. This pair of lucky boxing gloves will boost Chansey’s critical-hit ratio by two stages!

metalpowder.name: Metal Powder
metalpowder.desc: An item to be held by Ditto. Extremely fine yet hard, this odd powder doubles the Defense stat. Only works when not transformed.

thickclub.name: Thick Club
thickclub.desc: An item to be held by Cubone or Marowak. It’s a hard bone of some sort that doubles the current Attack stat!

stick.name: Stick
stick.desc: An item to be held by Farfetch’d. This very long and stiff stalk of leek boosts its critical-hit ratio by two stages!

redscarf.name: Red Scarf
redscarf.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. During a contest, it raises the Cool aspect of the Pokémon holding it.

bluescarf.name: Blue Scarf
bluescarf.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. During a contest, it raises the Beauty aspect of the Pokémon holding it.

pinkscarf.name: Pink Scarf
pinkscarf.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. During a contest, it raises the Cute aspect of the Pokémon holding it.

greenscarf.name: Green Scarf
greenscarf.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. During a contest, it raises the Clever aspect of the Pokémon holding it.

yellowscarf.name: Yellow Scarf
yellowscarf.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. During a contest, it raises the Tough aspect of the Pokémon holding it.

widelens.name: Wide Lens
widelens.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a magnifying lens that boosts the Accuracy of moves by 10%.

muscleband.name: Muscle Band
muscleband.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This headband exudes strength, boosting the power of physical moves by 10%.

wiseglasses.name: Wise Glasses
wiseglasses.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This thick pair of glasses boosts the power of special moves by 10%.

expertbelt.name: Expert Belt
expertbelt.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a well-worn belt that boosts the power of supereffective moves by 20%.

lightclay.name: Light Clay
lightclay.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Protective moves like Light Screen and Reflect will be effective for 8 turns instead of 5.

lifeorb.name: Life Orb
lifeorb.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the power of moves by 30%, but at the cost of 10% HP on each attack.

powerherb.name: Power Herb
powerherb.desc: A single-use item to be held by a Pokémon. It allows the holder to immediately use a move that normally requires a turn to charge.

toxicorb.name: Toxic Orb
toxicorb.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a bizarre orb that will badly poison the holder during battle.

flameorb.name: Flame Orb
flameorb.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a bizarre orb that will afflict the holder with a burn during battle.

quickpowder.name: Quick Powder
quickpowder.desc: An item to be held by Ditto. Extremely fine yet hard, this odd powder doubles the Speed stat. Only works when not transformed.

focussash.name: Focus Sash
focussash.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder has full HP, it will endure a potential KO attack with 1 HP. The item then disappears.

zoomlens.name: Zoom Lens
zoomlens.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder moves after its target moves, its Accuracy will be boosted by 20%.

metronome.name: Metronome
metronome.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts moves used consecutively until a different move is used. Boosts power by 20% each turn up to 100%.

ironball.name: Iron Ball
ironball.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It halves Speed and allows Ground-type moves to hit Flying-type and levitating holders. (130 Power if thrown with Fling.)

laggingtail.name: Lagging Tail
laggingtail.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It is tremendously heavy and makes the holder move last in its priority bracket, regardless of Speed.

destinyknot.name: Destiny Knot
destinyknot.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder becomes infatuated, the opposing Pokémon will be, too.

blacksludge.name: Black Sludge
blacksludge.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It gradually restores 1/16 HP to Poison-type Pokémon each turn. It damages any other type by 1/8 per turn.

icyrock.name: Icy Rock
icyrock.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of Hail when created by the holder to 8 turns instead of 5.

smoothrock.name: Smooth Rock
smoothrock.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of Sandstorm when created by the holder to 8 turns instead of 5.

heatrock.name: Heat Rock
heatrock.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of Harsh Sunlight when created by the holder to 8 turns instead of 5.

damprock.name: Damp Rock
damprock.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of Rain when created by the holder to 8 turns instead of 5.

gripclaw.name: Grip Claw
gripclaw.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of binding attacks like Bind and Whirlpool to a fixed full 7 turns of damage and trapping.

choicescarf.name: Choice Scarf
choicescarf.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This curious scarf boosts Speed by 50% but only allows the use of one move until switched out.

stickybarb.name: Sticky Barb
stickybarb.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It damages the holder every turn by 1/6 HP and will stick on to Pokémon that make contact with the holder and currently have no item.

powerbracer.name: Power Bracer
powerbracer.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It halves Speed but allows the holder’s Attack stat to grow more after battling.

powerbelt.name: Power Belt
powerbelt.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It halves Speed but allows the holder’s Defense stat to grow more after battling.

powerlens.name: Power Lens
powerlens.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It halves Speed but allows the holder’s Sp. Atk stat to grow more after battling.

powerband.name: Power Band
powerband.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It halves Speed but allows the holder’s Sp. Def stat to grow more after battling.

poweranklet.name: Power Anklet
poweranklet.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It halves Speed but allows the holder’s Speed stat to grow more after battling.

powerweight.name: Power Weight
powerweight.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It halves Speed but allows the holder’s maximum HP to grow more after battling.

shedshell.name: Shed Shell
shedshell.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This discarded carapace enables the holder to switch out of battle without fail, even if trapped, bound, or rooted.

bigroot.name: Big Root
bigroot.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts the amount of HP the holder recovers from HP-stealing moves by 40%. Also Aqua Ring, Ingrain, Leech Seed, and Str. Sap.

choicespecs.name: Choice Specs
choicespecs.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These curious glasses boost Sp. Atk by 50% but only allows the use of one move until switched out.

flameplate.name: Flame Plate
flameplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Fire-type moves by 20%.

splashplate.name: Splash Plate
splashplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Water-type moves by 20%.

zapplate.name: Zap Plate
zapplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Electric-type moves by 20%.

meadowplate.name: Meadow Plate
meadowplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Grass-type moves by 20%.

icicleplate.name: Icicle Plate
icicleplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Ice-type moves by 20%.

fistplate.name: Fist Plate
fistplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Fighting-type moves by 20%.

toxicplate.name: Toxic Plate
toxicplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Poison-type moves by 20%.

earthplate.name: Earth Plate
earthplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Ground-type moves by 20%.

skyplate.name: Sky Plate
skyplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Flying-type moves by 20%.

mindplate.name: Mind Plate
mindplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Psychic-type moves by 20%.

insectplate.name: Insect Plate
insectplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Bug-type moves by 20%.

stoneplate.name: Stone Plate
stoneplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Rock-type moves by 20%.

spookyplate.name: Spooky Plate
spookyplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Ghost-type moves by 20%.

dracoplate.name: Draco Plate
dracoplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Dragon-type moves by 20%.

dreadplate.name: Dread Plate
dreadplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Dark-type moves by 20%.

ironplate.name: Iron Plate
ironplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Steel-type moves by 20%.

oddincense.name: Odd Incense
oddincense.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense boosts the power of Psychic-type moves by 20%.

rockincense.name: Rock Incense
rockincense.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense boosts the power of Rock-type moves by 20%.

fullincense.name: Full Incense
fullincense.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense makes the holder bloated and slow moving, going last in its priority bracket.

waveincense.name: Wave Incense
waveincense.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This incense has a curious aroma that boosts the power of Water-type moves by 20%.

roseincense.name: Rose Incense
roseincense.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This exotic-smelling incense boosts the power of Grass-type moves by 20%.

luckincense.name: Luck Incense
luckincense.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It doubles any prize money received if the holding Pokémon joins a battle.

pureincense.name: Pure Incense
pureincense.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It helps keep wild Pokémon away if the holder is the head of the party.

protector.name: Protector
protector.desc: A protective item of some sort. It is extremely stiff and heavy. It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

electirizer.name: Electirizer
electirizer.desc: A box packed with a tremendous amount of electric energy. It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

magmarizer.name: Magmarizer
magmarizer.desc: A box packed with a tremendous amount of magma energy. It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

dubiousdisc.name: Dubious Disc
dubiousdisc.desc: A transparent device overflowing with dubious data. Its producer is unknown.

reapercloth.name: Reaper Cloth
reapercloth.desc: A cloth imbued with horrifyingly strong spiritual energy. It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

razorclaw.name: Razor Claw
razorclaw.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This sharply hooked claw increases the holder’s critical-hit ratio by 1 stage.

razorfang.name: Razor Fang
razorfang.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder successfully inflicts damage, the target has a 10% chance to flinch if the move doesn't already cause flinch.

tm01.name: TM01
tm01.desc: Enables the user to block all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.

tm02.name: TM02
tm02.desc: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it, including allies.

tm03.name: TM03
tm03.desc: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This attack does physical damage.

tm04.name: TM04
tm04.desc: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis. (10%)

tm05.name: TM05
tm05.desc: The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect. (Punch)

tm06.name: TM06
tm06.desc: The user attacks everything around it by swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.

tm07.name: TM07
tm07.desc: The user burrows, then attacks on the next turn.

tm08.name: TM08
tm08.desc: The user fights the target up close without guarding itself. This also lowers the user’s Defense and Sp. Def stats.

tm09.name: TM09
tm09.desc: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

tm10.name: TM10
tm10.desc: A unique attack that varies in type depending on the Pokémon using it. Go talk to the Breeder in Paniola’s Daycare to check your Pokémon’s Hidden Type!

tm11.name: TM11
tm11.desc: The user soars and then strikes its target on the next turn.

tm12.name: TM12
tm12.desc: The user turns the target’s power against it. The higher the target’s Attack stat, the greater the move’s power.

tm13.name: TM13
tm13.desc: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing Pokémon. This may also leave the opposing Pokémon frozen. (10%)

tm14.name: TM14
tm14.desc: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. This may also leave the target frozen. (10%)

tm15.name: TM15
tm15.desc: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. This may also leave the target with a burn. (10%)

tm16.name: TM16
tm16.desc: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from special attacks for five turns on the user’s side of the field.

tm17.name: TM17
tm17.desc: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from physical attacks for five turns on the user’s side of the field.

tm18.name: TM18
tm18.desc: Diving on the first turn, the user floats up and attacks on the next turn.

tm19.name: TM19
tm19.desc: The user lands and rests its body. It restores the user’s HP by up to half of its max HP. The user loses the Flying-type until the end of the turn.

tm20.name: TM20
tm20.desc: Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks. This, move raises the user's Speed.

tm21.name: TM21
tm21.desc: The user stimulates its brain by thinking bad thoughts. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Atk stat.

tm22.name: TM22
tm22.desc: This attack move doubles its power if the user is poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.

tm23.name: TM23
tm23.desc: Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.

tm24.name: TM24
tm24.desc: The target is attacked with a powerful beam. The user can’t move on the next turn and restores 15% of damage dealt.

tm25.name: TM25
tm25.desc: In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then fires the beam on the next turn. Fires instantly if used in Sun. Deals half damage in Rain, Sand, or Hail.

tm26.name: TM26
tm26.desc: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws. Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Atk.

tm27.name: TM27
tm27.desc: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.

tm28.name: TM28
tm28.desc: The user attacks by swinging its tail as if it were a vicious wave in a raging storm.

tm29.name: TM29
tm29.desc: The user tears at the target with blades formed by psychic power. Critical hits land more easily. (+1 Crit)

tm30.name: TM30
tm30.desc: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat. (20%, Bullet)

tm31.name: TM31
tm31.desc: The user makes a swift attack on the target’s legs, which lowers the target’s Speed stat.

tm32.name: TM32
tm32.desc: The user strikes everything around it by stomping down on the ground. This lowers the Speed stat of those hit.

tm33.name: TM33
tm33.desc: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. This may also confuse the target. (20%, Pulse)

tm34.name: TM34
tm34.desc: The user attacks by wrapping its opponent in a fierce wind that flies up into the sky. This may also confuse the target. (30%)

tm35.name: TM35
tm35.desc: The target is attacked with an intense blast of all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target with a burn. (10%)

tm36.name: TM36
tm36.desc: The user slashes at the target by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors. Critical hits land more easily. (+1 Crit)

tm37.name: TM37
tm37.desc: The user vanishes somewhere, then strikes the target on the next turn. This move hits even if the target protects itself.

tm38.name: TM38
tm38.desc: The user plays rough with the target and attacks it. This may also lower the target’s Attack stat. (10%)

tm39.name: TM39
tm39.desc: The user drenches the target in a special poisonous liquid. This move’s power is doubled if the target is poisoned.

tm40.name: TM40
tm40.desc: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body, raising both its Attack and Defense stats.

tm41.name: TM41
tm41.desc: Striking opponents over and over makes the user’s fists harder. Hitting a target raises the Attack stat. (Punch)

tm42.name: TM42
tm42.desc: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.

tm43.name: TM43
tm43.desc: The user jets itself into the target at intense speeds to warm its body up. This attack raises the user's Speed.

tm44.name: TM44
tm44.desc: The target is hit with rhythmically launched punches. This may also leave the target confused. (20%, Punch)

tm45.name: TM45
tm45.desc: The user attacks with a blade of air that slices even the sky. This may also make the target flinch. (30%)

tm46.name: TM46
tm46.desc: The user attacks and captures opposing Pokémon using an electric net. This lowers their Speed stats.

tm47.name: TM47
tm47.desc: The user alters its cellular structure to liquefy itself, raising its Defense and Sp.Atk stats.

tm48.name: TM48
tm48.desc: The user yells as if it’s ranting about something, which lowers the Sp. Atk stat of opposing Pokémon. (Sound)

tm49.name: TM49
tm49.desc: The user attacks the target with a song. Others can use Round too to double the power of the attacks. (Sound)

tm50.name: TM50
tm50.desc: In this two-turn attack, blades of wind hit opposing Pokémon on the second turn. The user's Sp.Atk is raised after use.

tm51.name: TM51
tm51.desc: The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also raise the user’s Defense stat. (25%)

tm52.name: TM52
tm52.desc: The user slams the target with its steel-hard head. This may also make the target flinch. (30%)

tm53.name: TM53
tm53.desc: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat. (10%, Bullet)

tm54.name: TM54
tm54.desc: The user whips up a vicious tornado to tear at the opposing Pokémon. This also lowers the opponent's Attack stats.

tm55.name: TM55
tm55.desc: The user shoots boiling hot water at its target. This may also leave the target with a burn. (30%)

tm56.name: TM56
tm56.desc: The user attacks with a gust of chilled air. This also lowers the opposing Pokémon’s Speed stats.

tm57.name: TM57
tm57.desc: The user attacks with an electric charge. The user will use any remaining electricity to raise its Sp. Atk stat.

tm58.name: TM58
tm58.desc: The user attacks by breathing a special, hot fire. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

tm59.name: TM59
tm59.desc: The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that paralyzes the target.

tm60.name: TM60
tm60.desc: The target is attacked with a shock wave generated by the user’s gaping mouth. May raise the user’s Sp.Atk stat. (10%, Pulse)

tm61.name: TM61
tm61.desc: The user shoots a sinister, bluish-white flame at the target to inflict a burn.

tm62.name: TM62
tm62.desc: The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not holding an item, this attack inflicts double damage. (Dance)

tm63.name: TM63
tm63.desc: The user lets loose a blast of aura power from deep within its body at the target. This attack never misses. (Pulse, Bullet)

tm64.name: TM64
tm64.desc: The user attacks everything around it by causing a tremendous explosion. The user faints upon using this move.

tm65.name: TM65
tm65.desc: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.

tm66.name: TM66
tm66.desc: An energy-draining punch. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target. (Punch)

tm67.name: TM67
tm67.desc: The target is cut with a scythe or claw. Critical hits land more easily. (+1 Crit)

tm68.name: TM68
tm68.desc: The user bites the target with its psychic capabilities. This can also destroy Light Screen and Reflect. (Jaw)

tm69.name: TM69
tm69.desc: The target is punched with an icy fist. This may also leave the target frozen. (15%, Punch)

tm70.name: TM70
tm70.desc: This move reduces damage from physical and special moves by 33% for five turns. This can be used only in a hailstorm.

tm71.name: TM71
tm71.desc: The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat. (10%)

tm72.name: TM72
tm72.desc: Large boulders are hurled at the opposing Pokémon to inflict damage. This may also make the opposing Pokémon flinch. (20%)

tm73.name: TM73
tm73.desc: The user attacks with a sinister beam of light. This may also confuse the target. (10%)

tm74.name: TM74
tm74.desc: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target. (30%, Bullet)

tm75.name: TM75
tm75.desc: The user crashes into its target while rotating its body like a drill. Critical hits land more easily. (+1 Crit)

tm76.name: TM76
tm76.desc: The user strikes thrice with a three-beam attack. May also burn, freeze, or paralyze the target. 8% chance to status per hit.

tm77.name: TM77
tm77.desc: The target is punched with a fiery fist. This may also leave the target with a burn. (15%, Punch)

tm78.name: TM78
tm78.desc: The user meditates to awaken the power deep within its body and raise its Attack and Sp. Def stats.

tm79.name: TM79
tm79.desc: The user blows its cold breath on the target. This attack always results in a critical hit.

tm80.name: TM80
tm80.desc: The user attacks with a ray of light that sparkles as if it were made of gemstones.

tm81.name: TM81
tm81.desc: The user slashes with a sharp claw made from shadows. Critical hits land more easily. (+1 Crit)

tm82.name: TM82
tm82.desc: The user attacks by launching waves of mud at every Pokémon. This may also lower their Speed stats. (30%)

tm83.name: TM83
tm83.desc: The user strikes the target with a quick jolt of electricity. This attack never misses.

tm84.name: TM84
tm84.desc: The target is attacked by a powerful kick. It also cuts the user's Defenses.

tm85.name: TM85
tm85.desc: The user launches a kick that lands a critical hit more easily. This may also leave the target with a burn. (+1 Crit, 10% Burn)

tm86.name: TM86
tm86.desc: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

tm87.name: TM87
tm87.desc: The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes its power. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat. (10%. Bullet)

tm88.name: TM88
tm88.desc: The user confounds the target with speed, then slashes. This attack never misses.

tm89.name: TM89
tm89.desc: The target is punched with an electrified fist. This may also leave the target with paralysis. (15%, Punch)

tm90.name: TM90
tm90.desc: The user focuses its willpower to its head and attacks the target. This may also make the target flinch. (20%)

tm91.name: TM91
tm91.desc: The user gathers all its light energy and releases it all at once. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat. (10%)

tm92.name: TM92
tm92.desc: The user makes the ground under the target erupt with power. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat. (10%)

hm01.name: HM01
hm01.desc: The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled seeds down on the target from above. (Bullet)

hm02.name: HM02
hm02.desc: The user soars and then strikes its target on the next turn. This can also be used to fly to any familiar town.

hm03.name: HM03
hm03.desc: The user attacks everything around it by swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.

hm04.name: HM04
hm04.desc: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power. This can also be used to move heavy boulders.

hm05.name: HM05
hm05.desc: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch. This can also be used to climb a waterfall.

hm06.name: HM06
hm06.desc: The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat. This move can also shatter rocks in the field.

explorerkit.name: Explorer Kit
explorerkit.desc: A bag filled with convenient tools for exploring. It provides access to the Underground in the Sinnoh region.

lootsack.name: Loot Sack
lootsack.desc: A sturdy, spacious bag that is used to carry any treasures or loot obtained in the coal mine.

rulebook.name: Rule Book
rulebook.desc: It lists the rules for holding battles. For Link Battles, you may choose which set of rules you wish to use.

pokradar.name: Poké Radar
pokradar.desc: A tool that can search out Pokémon that are hiding in the tall grass. Its battery is recharged as you walk.

pointcard.name: Point Card
pointcard.desc: A card that lists how many Battle Points you have earned.

journal.name: Journal
journal.desc: A notebook that keeps a day-to-day record of your adventure so far.

bluebox.name: Blue Box
bluebox.desc: A blueish box that can influence a Pokémon's gender. Can force certain Pokémon into their more masculine-presenting evolutions, regardless of gender. For: NidoranF, Wurmple, Kirlia, Cacnea, Snorunt, Clamperl, Burmy, Espurr.

pinkbox.name: Pink Box
pinkbox.desc: A pinkish box that can influence a Pokémon's gender. Can force certain Pokémon into their more feminine-presenting evolutions, regardless of gender. For: NidoranF, Wurmple, Kirlia, Cacnea, Snorunt, Clamperl, Burmy, Espurr.

sealbag.name: Seal Bag
sealbag.desc: A tiny bag that can hold 10 Seals for decorating Poké Balls.

palpad.name: Pal Pad
palpad.desc: A convenient notepad that is used to register your Friends and friend codes and keep a record of your gameplay.

workskey.name: Works Key
workskey.desc: A large key for operating the doors of the Valley Windworks in the canyon. It was held by a Team Galactic Grunt.

oldcharm.name: Old Charm
oldcharm.desc: An ancient good-luck charm made of Pokémon bones to be taken to the elder of Celestic Town.

galactickey.name: Galactic Key
galactickey.desc: A card key for disengaging the security systems in the Galactic HQ. Losing it can result in punishment, apparently.

redchain.name: Red Chain
redchain.desc: A mythical chain that is said to link the Legendary Pokémon that created the Sinnoh region.

townmap.name: Town Map
townmap.desc: A very convenient map that can be viewed anytime. It even shows you your present location in the region.

vsseeker.name: Vs. Seeker
vsseeker.desc: A device that indicates Trainers who want to battle. Its battery charges while you walk.

coincase.name: Coin Case
coincase.desc: A case for holding coins obtained at the Game Corner. It can hold up to 50,000 coins.

oldrod.name: Old Rod
oldrod.desc: An old and beat-up fishing rod. Use it at any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

goodrod.name: Good Rod
goodrod.desc: A new, good-quality fishing rod. Use it at any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

superrod.name: Super Rod
superrod.desc: An awesome, high-tech fishing rod. Use it at any body of water to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

sprayduck.name: Sprayduck
sprayduck.desc: A watering can shaped like a Psyduck. It helps promote the healthy growth of any Berries planted in good, soft soil.

candybox.name: Candy Box
candybox.desc: A box filled to the brim with energizing Rare Candies. Be careful not to overindulge! Check your Trainer Passport for Level Caps!

bike.name: Bike
bike.desc: A folding Bike that enables a rider to get around much faster than with Running Shoes.

suitekey.name: Suite Key
suitekey.desc: A key to one of the suites at a certain luxury hotel by a lake. For some odd reason, it often disappears.

oaksletter.name: Oak’s Letter
oaksletter.desc: A letter from Professor Oak. Written in it is a request for you to go to Route 224.

lunarwing.name: Lunar Wing
lunarwing.desc: A feather that glows like the moon. It’s said to possess the power to dispel nightmares.

membercard.name: Member Card
membercard.desc: A card needed for entering the inn in Canalave City. Oddly, the last date marked on it was 50 years ago.

revivalflute.name: Revival Flute
revivalflute.desc: A flute that puts out echoing sounds that do not seem to be of this world. Revives all Pokémon in the user's party outside of battle.

ssticket.name: S.S. Ticket
ssticket.desc: Ticket required for sailing on a ferry.

contestpass.name: Contest Pass
contestpass.desc: A pass required for entering Pokémon Contests. It has a drawing of an award ribbon on its front.

magmastone.name: Magma Stone
magmastone.desc: A stone formed by boulders melting in intensely hot magma, then hardening. Magma remains sealed inside it.

parcel.name: Parcel
parcel.desc: A parcel entrusted into your care. You’re supposed to deliver it to your childhood friend who left Twinleaf Town.

coupon1.name: Coupon 1
coupon1.desc: A coupon to be exchanged for a Pokémon Watch— Pokétch for short. Three coupons are needed.

coupon2.name: Coupon 2
coupon2.desc: A coupon to be exchanged for a Pokémon Watch— Pokétch for short. Three coupons are needed.

coupon3.name: Coupon 3
coupon3.desc: A coupon to be exchanged for a Pokémon Watch— Pokétch for short. Three coupons are needed.

storagekey.name: Storage Key
storagekey.desc: A key that opens the storage hold inside Sea Mauville.

miraclemeds.name: Miracle Meds
miraclemeds.desc: A fantastic medicine dispensed by the pharmacy in Cianwood City. It fully heals a Pokémon's HP and PP, and restores all Status.

vsrecorder.name: Vs. Recorder
vsrecorder.desc: An amazing device that can record a battle between friends or the battles at certain special battle facilities.

gracidea.name: Gracidea
gracidea.desc: A flower sometimes bundled in bouquets to convey gratitude on special occasions like birthdays.

secretkey.name: Secret Key
secretkey.desc: A high-tech key that has to be used at a specific location. It emits a special electronic signal to open a door.

apricornbox.name: Apricorn Box
apricornbox.desc: A handy box where you can store up to 99 of each kind of Apricorn.

unownreport.name: Unown Report
unownreport.desc: A report of all the discovered kinds of Unown.

berrypots.name: Berry Pots
berrypots.desc: Handy containers for cultivating Berries wherever you go.

dowsingmachine.name: Dowsing Machine
dowsingmachine.desc: This high-tech machine shows the location of invisible items. It’s attached to the head when in use.

bluecard.name: Blue Card
bluecard.desc: A card to save points for the Buena’s Password show.

slowpoketail.name: Slowpoke Tail
slowpoketail.desc: A very tasty tail of something. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

clearbell.name: Clear Bell
clearbell.desc: A very old-fashioned bell that makes a gentle ringing sound.

cardkey.name: Card Key
cardkey.desc: A card key that opens a shutter in the Radio Tower.

basementkey.name: Basement Key
basementkey.desc: The key to New Mauville, which was constructed beneath Mauville City.

squirtbottle.name: Squirt Bottle
squirtbottle.desc: A bottle used for watering plants in the Berry Pots.

redscale.name: Red Scale
redscale.desc: A scale from a red Gyarados. It glows red like a flame.

lostitem.name: Lost Item
lostitem.desc: The Mime Jr. doll that was lost by the Copycat.

pass.name: Pass
pass.desc: A pass required for riding the Magnet Train. It allows you to ride whenever and however much you’d like.

machinepart.name: Machine Part
machinepart.desc: An important part of a machine that was stolen from the Power Plant.

silverwing.name: Silver Wing
silverwing.desc: A strange, silvery feather that sparkles.

rainbowwing.name: Rainbow Wing
rainbowwing.desc: A mystical rainbow feather that sparkles.

mysteryegg.name: Mystery Egg
mysteryegg.desc: A mysterious Egg obtained from Mr. Pokémon. What is in the Egg is unknown.

redapricorn.name: Red Apricorn
redapricorn.desc: A red Apricorn. It assails your nostrils.

blueapricorn.name: Blue Apricorn
blueapricorn.desc: A blue Apricorn. It smells a bit like grass.

yellowapricorn.name: Yellow Apricorn
yellowapricorn.desc: A yellow Apricorn. It has an invigorating scent.

greenapricorn.name: Green Apricorn
greenapricorn.desc: A green Apricorn. It has a mysterious, aromatic scent.

pinkapricorn.name: Pink Apricorn
pinkapricorn.desc: A pink Apricorn. It has a nice, sweet scent.

whiteapricorn.name: White Apricorn
whiteapricorn.desc: A white Apricorn. It doesn’t smell like anything.

blackapricorn.name: Black Apricorn
blackapricorn.desc: A black Apricorn. It has a scent beyond one’s experience.

fastball.name: Fast Ball
fastball.desc: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch Pokémon that have a base Speed of 100 or more. (4x Catch Rate)

levelball.name: Level Ball
levelball.desc: A Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch Pokémon that are at a lower level than your own Pokémon. (1x-4x catch rate if your level is up to 4x greater than it)

lureball.name: Lure Ball
lureball.desc: A Poké Ball that is good for catching Pokémon that you reel in with a rod while out fishing. (5x catch rate)

heavyball.name: Heavy Ball
heavyball.desc: A Poké Ball that is better than usual at catching very heavy Pokémon. (-20 - +40 catch rate based on weight.)

loveball.name: Love Ball
loveball.desc: A Poké Ball that works best when catching a Pokémon that is of the opposite gender of your Pokémon. (8x catch rate if target is same species, opposite gender.)

friendball.name: Friend Ball
friendball.desc: A strange Poké Ball that will make the wild Pokémon caught with it more friendly toward you immediately. (1x catch rate, sets Friendship to 200 on catch.)

moonball.name: Moon Ball
moonball.desc: A Poké Ball that will make it easier to catch Pokémon that can evolve using a Moon Stone. (4x)

sportball.name: Sport Ball
sportball.desc: A special Poké Ball that is used during the Bug-Catching Contest. (1x)

parkball.name: Park Ball
parkball.desc: A special Poké Ball for the Pal Park.

photoalbum.name: Photo Album
photoalbum.desc: A nice photo album for storing all the photos taken along your adventure.

gbsounds.name: GB Sounds
gbsounds.desc: A music player that allows you to listen to nostalgic songs. It’s operated with the flip of a single switch.

tidalbell.name: Tidal Bell
tidalbell.desc: A very old-fashioned bell that makes a gentle ringing sound.

ragecandybar.name: Rage Candy Bar
ragecandybar.desc: Mahogany Town’s famous candy. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

raticatite.name: Raticatite
raticatite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Alolan Raticate hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

marowakite.name: Marowakite
marowakite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Alolan Marowak hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

gumshoosite.name: Gumshoosite
gumshoosite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Gumshoos hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

vikavoltite.name: Vikavoltite
vikavoltite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Vikavolt hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

ribombite.name: Ribombite
ribombite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Ribombee hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

araquanite.name: Araquanite
araquanite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Araquanid hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

lurantite.name: Lurantite
lurantite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Lurantis hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

salazzlite.name: Salazzlite
salazzlite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Salazzle hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

togedemarinite.name: Togedemarinite
togedemarinite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Togedemaru hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

mimikyunite.name: Mimikyunite
mimikyunite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Mimikyu hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

kommoonite.name: Kommo-onite
kommoonite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Kommo-o hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

greninjite.name: Greninjite
greninjite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Greninja hold it to Mega Evolve. Mega Greninja's Water Shuriken is boosted!

darmanitanite.name: Darmanitanite
darmanitanite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Darmanitan hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

datacard14.name: Data Card 14
datacard14.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many times your Pokémon tackled in the Pokéathlon.

datacard15.name: Data Card 15
datacard15.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many times your Pokémon fell down in the Pokéathlon.

datacard16.name: Data Card 16
datacard16.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many times you won the Pokéathlon’s Ring Drop.

datacard17.name: Data Card 17
datacard17.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many times you won the Pokéathlon’s Lamp Jump.

datacard18.name: Data Card 18
datacard18.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many times you won the Pokéathlon’s Circle Push.

datacard19.name: Data Card 19
datacard19.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many Link Pokéathlon wins you have had.

datacard20.name: Data Card 20
datacard20.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many Link Pokéathlon losses you have had.

datacard21.name: Data Card 21
datacard21.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many times you have won a Pokéathlon event.

datacard22.name: Data Card 22
datacard22.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many times you have lost a Pokéathlon event.

datacard23.name: Data Card 23
datacard23.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many times you switched Pokémon in the Pokéathlon.

datacard24.name: Data Card 24
datacard24.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many times you won the Pokéathlon’s Goal Roll.

datacard25.name: Data Card 25
datacard25.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many times your Pokémon won individual prizes.

datacard26.name: Data Card 26
datacard26.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how many times you instructed your Pokémon.

datacard27.name: Data Card 27
datacard27.desc: It holds Pokéathlon records. It is a card that shows how much time you spent participating in the Pokéathlon.

jadeorb.name: Jade Orb
jadeorb.desc: A shiny green orb that is said to have a legend tied to it. It’s known to have a deep connection with the Hoenn region.

lockcapsule.name: Lock Capsule
lockcapsule.desc: A sturdy Capsule that can only be opened with a special key.

redorb.name: Red Orb
redorb.desc: A shiny red orb that is said to have a legend tied to it. It’s known to have a deep connection with the Hoenn region. Give to Groudon to induce transformation.

blueorb.name: Blue Orb
blueorb.desc: A shiny blue orb that is said to have a legend tied to it. It’s known to have a deep connection with the Hoenn region. Give to Kyogre to induce transformation.

enigmastone.name: Enigma Stone
enigmastone.desc: A crystal ball that was excavated from the ground. It’s a very beautiful stone that is covered with bits of rock and earth.

prismscale.name: Prism Scale
prismscale.desc: A mysterious scale that causes a certain Pokémon to evolve. It shines in rainbow colors.

eviolite.name: Eviolite
eviolite.desc: A mysterious Evolutionary lump. When held by a Pokémon that can still evolve, it raises both Defense and Sp. Def by 50%.

floatstone.name: Float Stone
floatstone.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This very light stone halves the weight of a Pokémon when held, reducing damage taken from Low Kick and Grass Knot.

rockyhelmet.name: Rocky Helmet
rockyhelmet.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder is hit, the attacker will also be damaged upon contact for 1/6 of their max HP.

airballoon.name: Air Balloon
airballoon.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder will float in the air until hit, making them immune to Ground-Type moves and floor hazards. Once hit, it pops.

redcard.name: Red Card
redcard.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder is hit by an attack, the attacker is removed from battle and replaced with a random party member.

ringtarget.name: Ring Target
ringtarget.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Moves that normally have no effect will land on a Pokémon holding it. Try "gifting" this item to your opponents.

bindingband.name: Binding Band
bindingband.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. A band that increases the damage of binding moves used by the holder. Increases the damage from 1/8 Hp to 1/6.

absorbbulb.name: Absorb Bulb
absorbbulb.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Atk if hit with a Water-type attack. It can only be used once.

cellbattery.name: Cell Battery
cellbattery.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Attack if hit with an Electric-type attack. It can only be used once.

ejectbutton.name: Eject Button
ejectbutton.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder is hit by an attack, it will be switched out of battle and replaced by a Pokémon that you choose.

firegem.name: Fire Gem
firegem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Fire-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

watergem.name: Water Gem
watergem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Water-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

electricgem.name: Electric Gem
electricgem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of an Electric-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

grassgem.name: Grass Gem
grassgem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Grass-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

icegem.name: Ice Gem
icegem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of an Ice-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

fightinggem.name: Fighting Gem
fightinggem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Fighting-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

poisongem.name: Poison Gem
poisongem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Poison-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

groundgem.name: Ground Gem
groundgem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Ground-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

flyinggem.name: Flying Gem
flyinggem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Flying-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

psychicgem.name: Psychic Gem
psychicgem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Psychic-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

buggem.name: Bug Gem
buggem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Bug-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

rockgem.name: Rock Gem
rockgem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Rock-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

ghostgem.name: Ghost Gem
ghostgem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Ghost-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

dragongem.name: Dragon Gem
dragongem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Dragon-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

darkgem.name: Dark Gem
darkgem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Dark-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

steelgem.name: Steel Gem
steelgem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Steel-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

normalgem.name: Normal Gem
normalgem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Normal-type move one time. (30% damage boost)

healthwing.name: Health Wing
healthwing.desc: A nice looking feather! Does nothing. Sells for a small price.

musclewing.name: Muscle Wing
musclewing.desc: A nice looking feather! Does nothing. Sells for a small price.

geniuswing.desc: A nice looking feather! Does nothing. Sells for a small price.

cleverwing.desc: A nice looking feather! Does nothing. Sells for a small price.

swiftwing.name: Swift Wing
swiftwing.desc: A nice looking feather! Does nothing. Sells for a small price.

prettywing.name: Pretty Wing
prettywing.desc: Though this feather is beautiful, it’s just a regular feather and has no effect on Pokémon.

coverfossil.name: Cover Fossil
coverfossil.desc: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sea. It appears as though it could be part of its back.

plumefossil.name: Plume Fossil
plumefossil.desc: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived in the sky. It looks as if it could come from part of its wing.

libertypass.name: Liberty Pass
libertypass.desc: A special pass to go to Liberty Garden. Board the ship in Castelia City.

passorb.name: Pass Orb
passorb.desc: A mysterious orb containing the power of the Unova region, to be used when generating Pass Power.

dreamball.name: Dream Ball
dreamball.desc: A special Poké Ball that appears in your Bag out of nowhere in the Entree Forest. It can catch any Pokémon.

poktoy.name: Poké Toy
poktoy.desc: A toy that attracts the attention of a Pokémon. It guarantees escape from any battle with wild Pokémon.

propcase.name: Prop Case
propcase.desc: A lovely case to store colorful Props for your Pokémon to wear in a musical.

dragonskull.name: Dragon Skull
dragonskull.desc: A skull of a Pokémon that was said to have braved the angry waters to fly around the world.

balmmushroom.name: Balm Mushroom
balmmushroom.desc: A rare mushroom that gives off a nice fragrance. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

bignugget.name: Big Nugget
bignugget.desc: A big nugget of pure gold that gives off a lustrous gleam. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

pearlstring.name: Pearl String
pearlstring.desc: Very large pearls that sparkle in a pretty silver color. They can be sold at a high price to shops.

cometshard.name: Comet Shard
cometshard.desc: A shard that fell to the ground when a comet approached. It can be sold at a high price to shops.

reliccopper.name: Relic Copper
reliccopper.desc: A copper coin used by an ancient civilization about 3,000 years ago.

relicsilver.name: Relic Silver
relicsilver.desc: A silver coin used by an ancient civilization about 3,000 years ago.

relicgold.name: Relic Gold
relicgold.desc: A gold coin used by an ancient civilization about 3,000 years ago.

relicvase.name: Relic Vase
relicvase.desc: A fragile vase made by an ancient civilization about 3,000 years ago.

relicband.name: Relic Band
relicband.desc: A heavy bracelet made by an ancient civilization about 3,000 years ago.

relicstatue.name: Relic Statue
relicstatue.desc: A stone figurine made by an ancient civilization about 3,000 years ago.

reliccrown.name: Relic Crown
reliccrown.desc: A heavy crown made by an ancient civilization about 3,000 years ago.

casteliacone.name: Casteliacone
casteliacone.desc: Castelia City’s specialty, soft-serve ice cream. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

abilityurge.name: Ability Urge
abilityurge.desc: When used, it activates the Ability of an ally Pokémon.

itemdrop.name: Item Drop
itemdrop.desc: When used, it causes an ally Pokémon to drop a held item.

itemurge.name: Item Urge
itemurge.desc: When used, it causes an ally Pokémon to use its held item.

reseturge.name: Reset Urge
reseturge.desc: When used, it restores any stat changes of an ally Pokémon.

direhit3.name: Dire Hit 3
direhit3.desc: It can be used many times to greatly raise a Pokémon’s critical-hit ratio. It wears off if the Pokémon is withdrawn.

lightstone.name: Light Stone
lightstone.desc: Reshiram’s body was destroyed and changed into this stone. It is said to be waiting for the emergence of a hero.

darkstone.name: Dark Stone
darkstone.desc: Zekrom’s body was destroyed and changed into this stone. It is said to be waiting for the emergence of a hero.

tm93.name: TM93
tm93.desc: The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled seeds down on the target from above. (Bullet)

tm94.name: TM94
tm94.desc: The target is slugged by a punch thrown with muscle-packed power. This may lower the target's defense. (20%, Punch)

tm95.name: TM95
tm95.desc: The user slaps down the target’s held item, and that item can’t be used in that battle. The move does 50% more damage if the target has a held item.

xtransceiver.name: Xtransceiver
xtransceiver.desc: A high-tech transceiver with a camera function. It allows up to four-way calls.

gram1.name: Gram 1
gram1.desc: An important letter that Wingull delivers.

gram2.name: Gram 2
gram2.desc: An important letter that Wingull delivers.

gram3.name: Gram 3
gram3.desc: An important letter that Wingull delivers.

medalbox.name: Medal Box
medalbox.desc: A box-shaped machine that stores Medals and Medal information.

dnasplicers.name: DNA Splicers
dnasplicers.desc: A splicer that separates Kyurem and a certain Pokémon when they have been fused.

permit.name: Permit
permit.desc: A permit that is needed to enter the Nature Preserve. Not many know about it.

ovalcharm.name: Oval Charm
ovalcharm.desc: An oval charm said to increase the chance of Pokémon Eggs being found at the Nursery.

shinycharm.name: Shiny Charm
shinycharm.desc: A shiny charm said to increase the chance of finding a Shiny Pokémon in the wild.

plasmacard.name: Plasma Card
plasmacard.desc: A card key needed to enter the password inside the Plasma Frigate.

grubbyhanky.name: Grubby Hanky
grubbyhanky.desc: A handkerchief dropped by a regular at Café Warehouse. It smells faintly like a Pokémon.

colressmachine.name: Colress Machine
colressmachine.desc: A special device that wrings out the potential of Pokémon. It’s an imperfect prototype.

droppeditem.name: Dropped Item
droppeditem.desc: The Xtransceiver found at the Nimbasa City amusement park. It seems it belongs to a girl.

revealglass.name: Reveal Glass
revealglass.desc: A looking glass that reveals the truth. It’s a mysterious glass that returns a Pokémon to its original shape.

weaknesspolicy.name: Weakness Policy
weaknesspolicy.desc: A Weakness Policy. Raises Attack and Sp. Atk sharply if the holder is hit with a move it’s weak to.

assaultvest.name: Assault Vest
assaultvest.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This offensive vest raises Sp. Def by 50% but prevents the use of status moves.

holocaster.name: Holo Caster
holocaster.desc: A device that allows users to receive and view hologram clips at any time. It’s also used to chat with others.

profsletter.name: Prof’s Letter
profsletter.desc: A letter that Professor Sycamore wrote to your mother. A faint but pleasant perfume seems to cling to the paper.

rollerskates.name: Roller Skates
rollerskates.desc: Attaches roller skates to the bottom of your shoes, allowing you to glide quickly around and perform tricks.

pixieplate.name: Pixie Plate
pixieplate.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It’s a stone tablet that boosts the power of Fairy-type moves by 20%.

abilitypills.name: Ability Pills
abilitypills.desc: Capsules that allow Pokémon with two Abilities to switch between these Abilities when it is used. Hidden abilities are not compatible. (Reusable)

whippeddream.name: Whipped Dream
whippeddream.desc: A soft and sweet treat made of fluffy, puffy, whipped, and whirled cream. It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

sachet.name: Sachet
sachet.desc: A sachet filled with fragrant perfumes that are just slightly too overwhelming. Yet it’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

luminousmoss.name: Luminous Moss
luminousmoss.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def if hit with a Water-type attack. It can only be used once.

snowball.name: Snowball
snowball.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Attack if hit with an Ice-type attack. It can only be used once.

safetygoggles.name: Safety Goggles
safetygoggles.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These goggles protect the holder from both weather-related damage and powder/spore moves.

pokflute.name: Poké Flute
pokflute.desc: A flute that can play with such a beautiful tone that even sleeping Pokémon find themselves roused.

richmulch.name: Rich Mulch
richmulch.desc: A fertilizer for growing Berries. However, it appears to be unsuitable for the soil in the Hoenn region and has no effect.

roseliberry.name: Roseli Berry
roseliberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will halve the damage taken from one supereffective Fairy-type attack.

keeberry.name: Kee Berry
keeberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will increase the holder’s Defense if it’s hit with a physical move.

marangaberry.name: Maranga Berry
marangaberry.desc: If held by a Pokémon, this Berry will increase the holder’s Sp. Def if it’s hit with a special move.

sprinklotad.name: Sprinklotad
sprinklotad.desc: A watering can shaped like a Lotad. It helps promote the healthy growth of any Berries planted in good, soft soil.

tm96.name: TM96
tm96.desc: This attack makes use of nature’s power. Its effects vary depending on the user’s environment or terrain.

tm97.name: TM97
tm97.desc: The target is stabbed with a tentacle or arm steeped in poison. This may also poison the target. (30%, Punch)

tm98.name: TM98
tm98.desc: The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a powerful flash. This has a chance to drop the target’s Evasion stats. (25%)

tm99.name: TM99
tm99.desc: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to inflict damage. This may also paralyze. (30%) Always lands if raining. 50% acc in Hail, Sand, or Sun.

tm100.name: TM100
tm100.desc: The user attacks suddenly as if leaping out from tall grass. The user's nimble footwork boosts its Speed stat.

powerplantpass.name: Power Plant Pass
powerplantpass.desc: This pass serves as an ID card for gaining access to the power plant that lies along Route 13.

megaring.name: Mega Ring
megaring.desc: This ring contains an untold power that somehow enables Pokémon carrying Mega Stones to Mega Evolve in battle.

intriguingstone.name: Intriguing Stone
intriguingstone.desc: A rather curious stone that might appear valuable to some. It’s all in the eye of the beholder.

commonstone.name: Common Stone
commonstone.desc: A perfectly normal stone that might appear to be valuable to some. It’s all in the eye of the beholder.

discountcoupon.name: Discount Coupon
discountcoupon.desc: This special coupon allows you to buy items at a discount when you are shopping at a boutique.

elevatorkey.name: Elevator Key
elevatorkey.desc: A card key that activates the elevator in Lysandre Labs. It is emblazoned with Team Flare’s logo.

tmvpass.name: TMV Pass
tmvpass.desc: A commuter pass that allows the holder to ride the TMV between Lumiose City and Kiloude City at any time.

honorofkalos.name: Honor of Kalos
honorofkalos.desc: A precious symbol that is awarded only to an individual who has done great things for the Kalos region.

adventurerules.name: Adventure Rules
adventurerules.desc: This book contains all the points a new Trainer needs to know on a journey. It was handmade by a kind friend.

strangesouvenir.name: Strange Souvenir
strangesouvenir.desc: An ornament depicting a mysterious Pokémon that has been venerated as a guardian deity for an extremely long time in the Alola region.

lenscase.name: Lens Case
lenscase.desc: A rather chic-looking case for carrying contact lenses.

makeupbag.name: Makeup Bag
makeupbag.desc: A rather chic-looking case for carrying lipsticks.

traveltrunk.name: Travel Trunk
traveltrunk.desc: A light and yet incredibly effective trunk, which can contain every last piece of clothing that can be bought.

lumiosegalette.name: Lumiose Galette
lumiosegalette.desc: A popular treat in Lumiose City. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

shaloursable.name: Shalour Sable
shaloursable.desc: Shalour City’s famous shortbread. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

jawfossil.name: Jaw Fossil
jawfossil.desc: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It looks as if it could be a piece of a large jaw.

sailfossil.name: Sail Fossil
sailfossil.desc: A fossil from a prehistoric Pokémon that once lived on the land. It looks like the impression from a skin sail.

lookerticket.name: Looker Ticket
lookerticket.desc: A ticket that was handmade by Looker. It’s decorated with a liberal amount of glittery paint.

fairygem.name: Fairy Gem
fairygem.desc: A broken shard of a Z-Crystal. When held, it strengthens the power of a Fairy-type move one time. (30% boost)

megacharm.name: Mega Charm
megacharm.desc: This charm contains an untold power that somehow enables Pokémon carrying Mega Stones to Mega Evolve in battle.

megaglove.name: Mega Glove
megaglove.desc: This glove contains an untold power that somehow enables Pokémon carrying Mega Stones to Mega Evolve in battle.

machbike.name: Mach Bike
machbike.desc: This folding Bike more than doubles your movement speed.

acrobike.name: Acro Bike
acrobike.desc: This folding Bike allows you to perform actions such as wheelies and bunny hops.

wailmerpail.name: Wailmer Pail
wailmerpail.desc: This is a tool for watering Berries you planted to make them grow more quickly.

devonparts.name: Devon Parts
devonparts.desc: A case that contains mechanical parts of some sort made by the Devon Corporation.

sootsack.name: Soot Sack
sootsack.desc: A sack used to gather and hold volcanic ash.

pokblockkit.name: Pokéblock Kit
pokblockkit.desc: A set containing a Berry Blender for making Pokéblocks and a Pokéblock Case for storing Pokéblocks.

letter.name: Letter
letter.desc: An extremely important letter to Steven from the President of Devon Corporation.

eonticket.name: Eon Ticket
eonticket.desc: The ticket required for sailing on a ferry to the Southern Island. Does Norman, the Petalburg Gym Leader, know a secret?!

scanner.name: Scanner
scanner.desc: A device found inside Sea Mauville.

gogoggles.name: Go-Goggles
gogoggles.desc: Nifty goggles to protect eyes from desert sandstorms.

meteorite.name: Meteorite
meteorite.desc: A Meteorite that you got at Mt. Chimney. Some sort of pattern has risen to the surface, and it’s shining with seven colors of light.

keytoroom1.name: Key to Room 1
keytoroom1.desc: A key that opens a door inside Sea Mauville.

keytoroom2.name: Key to Room 2
keytoroom2.desc: A key that opens a door inside Sea Mauville.

keytoroom4.name: Key to Room 4
keytoroom4.desc: A key that opens a door inside Sea Mauville.

keytoroom6.name: Key to Room 6
keytoroom6.desc: A key that opens a door inside Sea Mauville.

devonscope.name: Devon Scope
devonscope.desc: A special device made by Devon Corporation that signals the presence of any unseen Pokémon.

hm07.name: HM07
hm07.desc: Diving on the first turn, the user floats up and attacks on the next turn.

devonscubagear.name: Devon Scuba Gear
devonscubagear.desc: A device made by Devon Corporation that provides oxygen to users during the use of Dive.

contestcostume.name: Contest Costume
contestcostume.desc: A very cute dress to be worn during the Contest Spectacular.

magmasuit.name: Magma Suit
magmasuit.desc: A suit made with the collective technological know-how of Team Magma. It can withstand any impact.

aquasuit.name: Aqua Suit
aquasuit.desc: A suit made with the collective technological know-how of Team Aqua. It can withstand any impact.

pairoftickets.name: Pair of Tickets
pairoftickets.desc: Tickets for two to the astronomical show being held at the Mossdeep Space Center.

glalitite.name: Glalitite
glalitite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Glalie hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

diancite.name: Diancite
diancite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Diancie hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

prisonbottle.name: Prison Bottle
prisonbottle.desc: A bottle believed to have been used to seal away the power of a certain Pokémon long, long ago.

megacuff.name: Mega Cuff
megacuff.desc: This bracelet contains an untold power that somehow enables Pokémon carrying a Mega Stone to Mega Evolve in battle.

cameruptite.name: Cameruptite
cameruptite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Camerupt hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

lopunnite.name: Lopunnite
lopunnite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Lopunny hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

salamencite.name: Salamencite
salamencite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Salamence hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

beedrillite.name: Beedrillite
beedrillite.desc: One of a variety of mysterious Mega Stones. Have Beedrill hold it, and this stone will enable it to Mega Evolve during battle.

keystone.name: Key Stone
keystone.desc: A stone filled with an unexplained power. It makes Pokémon that battle with a Mega Stone Mega Evolve.

meteoriteshard.name: Meteorite Shard
meteoriteshard.desc: One of the fragments of a Meteorite from Granite Cave. It’s faintly warm to the touch.

eonflute.name: Eon Flute
eonflute.desc: A flute that can be used to summon Latios or Latias no matter where you are.

firiumz.name: Firium Z
firiumz.desc: Upgrades Fire-type moves. Resonance Moves: Rapidash-H.Horsepower, MarowakA-ShadowBone, Octillery-Octazooka, Entei-EQ, Infernape-MachPunch, Magmortar-AuraSphere, RotomHeat-Hex

wateriumz.name: Waterium Z

electriumz.name: Electrium Z
electriumz.desc: Upgrades Electric-type moves. Resonance Moves: Raikou-Scald, Luxray-Crunch, Pachirisu-SuperFang, Electivire-Feint, Porygon-Z-TriAttack, Rotom-Hex, Zebstrika-BlazeKick, Emolga-WingAttack, Eelektross-Waterfall

grassiumz.name: Grassium Z
grassiumz.desc: Upgrades Grass-type moves. Resonance Moves: Vileplume-PollenPuff, Parasect-XScissor, Victreebel-Belch, ExeggutorAandK-EggBomb, Tropius-DragonHammer, Torterra-Earthquake, Carnivine-Crunch, Tangrowth-WringOut, RotomMow-Hex, Leavanny-FellStinger, Tsareena-KickStep

iciumz.name: Icium Z

fightiniumz.name: Fightinium Z
fightiniumz.desc: Upgrades Fighting moves. Resonance Moves: Primeape-StompTant., Machamp-BulletPunch, HMchan-MPunch, HMLee-MKick, HMTop-RapidSpin, Granbull-SweetTooth, Toxicroak-PoisonJab, Samurott-RazorShell, Scrafty-BeatUp, Mienshao-P.Geyser, Chesnaught-P.Blizz, Crabominable-IceHam

poisoniumz.desc: It upgrades Poison-type moves to Z-Moves. Special: Arbok’s Dragon Hammer, Weezing’s Flamethrower, Naganadel’s Dragon Pulse

groundiumz.name: Groundium Z
groundiumz.desc: It upgrades Ground-type moves to Z-Moves. Special: K.Marowak’s Shadow Bone, Stunfisk’s Discharge, K.Sandslash’s Slash

flyiniumz.name: Flyinium Z
flyiniumz.desc: It upgrades Flying-type moves to Z-Moves. Special: Hawlucha’s Flying Press, Delibird’s Present, Castform’s Weather Ball (All Forms)

psychiumz.name: Psychium Z

ghostiumz.name: Ghostium Z

pikaniumz.name: Pikanium Z
pikaniumz.desc: It upgrades Pikachu’s Volt Tackle to a Z-Move that raises Pikachu’s Attack and Speed stats by 2 stages! This move always lands as a Critical hit!

bottlecap.name: Bottle Cap
bottlecap.desc: A beautiful bottle cap that gives off a silver gleam. Some people are happy to receive one.

goldbottlecap.name: Gold Bottle Cap
goldbottlecap.desc: A beautiful bottle cap that gives off a golden gleam. Some people are happy to receive one.

zring.name: Z-Ring

tapuniumz.name: Tapunium Z
tapuniumz.desc: It upgrades the tapu’s Nature’s Madness to a Z-Move that reduces a target’s HP by 75%, the user restores 50% of the damage dealt.

marshadiumz.name: Marshadium Z
marshadiumz.desc: It upgrades Marshadow’s Spectral Thief to a Z-Move that heals Marshadow for 25% damage dealt.

raichiumz.name: Raichium Z
raichiumz.desc: It upgrades either Kanto or Alolan Raichu’s Volt Switch into a Z-Move that damages a target and raises Speed by 2 stage and Accuracy by 1.

snorliumz.name: Snorlium Z
snorliumz.desc: It upgrades Snorlax’s Giga Impact to a Z-Move that raises Snorlax’s Atk and Def, while lowering Speed.

eeviumz.name: Eevium Z
eeviumz.desc: It upgrades Eevee’s Last Resort to a Z-Move that raises all of Eevee’s stats by 4 stages!

mewniumz.name: Mewnium Z
mewniumz.desc: It upgrades Mew’s Psychic to a Z-Move that creates Psychic Terrain on the field.

alolansack.name: Alolan Sack
alolansack.desc: Essences of Alola can evolve Pokémon into tropical forms. Rattata,Pikachu,Sandshrew,Vulpix,Gloom,Diglett,Meowth, Poliwhirl,Graveler,Slowpoke,Grimer,Exeggcute,Cubone

fishingrod.name: Fishing Rod
fishingrod.desc: A fishing rod made by Captain Lana. Cast a line over piles of underwater rocks to fish for wild aquatic Pokémon.

professorsmask.name: Professor’s Mask
professorsmask.desc: The mask that belongs to The Masked Royal. This pro wrestler apparently sews his mask on a machine himself.

festivalticket.name: Festival Ticket
festivalticket.desc: A ticket that allows you to host a mission in Festival Plaza.

sparklingstone.name: Sparkling Stone
sparklingstone.desc: A stone entrusted by a Pokémon that has been venerated as a guardian deity in the Alola region. There is said to be some secret in how it sparkles.

adrenalineorb.name: Adrenaline Orb
adrenalineorb.desc: Using it makes wild Pokémon call for help more. It boosts Speed when intimidated. Is not used up when held and activated.

zygardecube.name: Zygarde Cube
zygardecube.desc: An item to store Zygarde Cores and Cells. You can also use it to teach Zygarde moves.

icestone.name: Ice Stone
icestone.desc: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It has an unmistakable snowflake pattern. Evolves: Eevee

ridepager.name: Ride Pager
ridepager.desc: By entering certain numbers on this pager, you can summon Ride Pokémon in an instant.

beastball.name: Beast Ball
beastball.desc: A special Poké Ball designed to catch Ultra Beasts. It has a low success rate for catching others. (5x Catch rate against UBs,.01x Catch rate otherwise.)

bigmalasada.name: Big Malasada
bigmalasada.desc: The Alola region’s local specialty—fried bread. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

rednectar.name: Red Nectar
rednectar.desc: A flower nectar obtained at Ula’ula Meadow. It changes Oricorio to Fire-Type.

yellownectar.name: Yellow Nectar
yellownectar.desc: A flower nectar obtained at Melemele Meadow. It changes Oricorio to Electric-Type.

pinknectar.name: Pink Nectar
pinknectar.desc: The flower nectar obtained at the flowering shrubs on Royal Avenue. It changes Oricorio to Psychic-Type.

purplenectar.name: Purple Nectar
purplenectar.desc: A flower nectar obtained at Poni Meadow. It changes Oricorio to Ghost-Type.

sunflute.name: Sun Flute
sunflute.desc: It is said that the tones it produces were offered up as an expression of gratitude to the Legendary Pokémon of the sun.

moonflute.name: Moon Flute
moonflute.desc: It is said that the tones it produces were offered up as an expression of gratitude to the Legendary Pokémon of the moon.

enigmaticcard.name: Enigmatic Card
enigmaticcard.desc: A mysterious card. Written on it is a request for you to go to a guest room in an Akala motel on Route 8.

terrainext.name: Terrain Ext.
terrainext.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It extends the duration of the terrain caused by the holder’s move or Ability to 8 turns from 5.

protpads.name: Prot. Pads
protpads.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These pads protect the holder from effects caused by making direct contact, like Static, Rocky Helmet, or Baneful Bunker.

electricseed.name: Electric Seed
electricseed.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense on Electric Terrain when consumed.

psychicseed.name: Psychic Seed
psychicseed.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def on Psychic Terrain when consumed.

mistyseed.name: Misty Seed
mistyseed.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Sp. Def on Misty Terrain when consumed.

grassyseed.name: Grassy Seed
grassyseed.desc: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It boosts Defense on Grassy Terrain when consumed.

lunaliumz.name: Lunalium Z
lunaliumz.desc: It upgrades Lunala’s Moongeist Beam to a Z-Move that raises Sp. Def.

ultranecroziumz.desc: It allows Necrozma Dusk Mane or Dawn Wings to transform! Also allows it to upgrade Photon Geyser into a powerful Z-move that hits both opponents and always Crits.

mimikiumz.name: Mimikium Z
mimikiumz.desc: It upgrades Mimikyu’s Play Rough to a Z-Move that binds the target for 4-5 turns, dealing persistent damage and trapping them.

lycaniumz.name: Lycanium Z
lycaniumz.desc: It upgrades Lycanroc’s Stone Edge to a Z-Move that clears Terrain from the field, and raises Lycanroc’s Defense and Accuracy stats.

kommoniumz.name: Kommonium Z
kommoniumz.desc: It upgrades Kommo-o’s Clanging Scales to a Z-Move that hits all Pokémon on the field, and raises all of Kommo-o’s stats 1 stage.

orangepetal.name: Orange Petal
orangepetal.desc: A pressed flower petal you receive from Ilima during Mina’s trial. The goal is to collect seven different kinds of petals.

rainbowflower.name: Rainbow Flower
rainbowflower.desc: A flower made of the petals you received from captains. It’s proof that your growth has been recognized by them.

kantobadge.name: Kanto Badge
kantobadge.desc: Memories of Kanto can evolve Pokémon into mainland forms. Rattata,Pichu,Pikachu,Sandshrew,Vulpix,Gloom,Diglett,Meowth, Poliwhirl,Graveler,Slowpoke,Grimer,Exeggcute,Cubone

nsolarizer.name: N-Solarizer
nsolarizer.desc: A machine to separate Necrozma, which needed light, from Solgaleo.

nlunarizer.name: N-Lunarizer
nlunarizer.desc: A machine to separate Necrozma, which needed light, from Lunala.

ilimasnormaliumz.name: Ilima’s Normalium Z
ilimasnormaliumz.desc: The Normalium Z you were entrusted with by Ilima. You were asked to place it on the pedestal at the back of Verdant Cavern.

leftpokball.name: Left Poké Ball
leftpokball.desc: A Poké Ball with a Pokémon that lost its Trainer inside. It seems to be from Ula’ula Island.

rotohatch.name: Roto Hatch
rotohatch.desc: One of the Rotom Cheats. It helps Eggs hatch faster.

rotobargain.name: Roto Bargain
rotobargain.desc: One of the Rotom Cheats. It reduces the prices of products at Poké Marts by half.

rotoprizemoney.name: Roto Prize Money
rotoprizemoney.desc: One of the Rotom Cheats. It triples the prize money you receive after battle.

rotoexppoints.name: Roto Exp. Points
rotoexppoints.desc: One of the Rotom Cheats. It increases the Exp. Points your Pokémon receive after battle a little.

rotofriendship.name: Roto Friendship
rotofriendship.desc: One of the Rotom Cheats. It helps Pokémon in your party grow friendly faster.

rotoencounter.name: Roto Encounter
rotoencounter.desc: One of the Rotom Cheats. It increases the chance of encountering high-level wild Pokémon a lot for a certain period of time.

rotostealth.name: Roto Stealth
rotostealth.desc: One of the Rotom Cheats. It prevents you from encountering wild Pokémon for a certain period of time.

rotohprestore.name: Roto HP Restore
rotohprestore.desc: One of the Rotom Cheats. It fully restores the HP of your battling Pokémon.

rotopprestore.name: Roto PP Restore
rotopprestore.desc: One of the Rotom Cheats. It fully restores the PP of your battling Pokémon.

rotoboost.name: Roto Boost
rotoboost.desc: One of the Rotom Cheats. It raises all stats of your battling Pokémon.

rotocatch.name: Roto Catch
rotocatch.desc: One of the Rotom Cheats. It increases the chance to catch Pokémon a lot.
